Command Line Arguments

1. update – Upgrade the program (for npm installation)  
2. remove – Uninstall the program (from npm) (for npm installation)  
3. version – Display the current version  
4. help – Show help information  
5. install – Install as a systemd service (Linux only)  
6. uninstall – Uninstall from systemd (Linux only)  
7. restart – Restart the systemd service (Linux only)  
8. stop – Stop the systemd service (Linux only)  

// The following parameters require additional values.  
// Example: "filecat --port 8080" to specify the port.

9. port – Port number the server will run on  
10. env – Path to the environment configuration file  
11. work_dir – Working directory for generated data (default is `./data` in the startup directory)  
12. base_folder – Root folder managed by FileCat (default is the startup directory)  
13. username – Login username (default is `admin`) (as of version 1.0.5, permissions are not yet implemented)  
14. password – Login password (default is `admin`)  
15. reset_root_username – Regenerate the admin username (remove this parameter after first use; same for the password below)  
16. reset_root_password – Regenerate the admin password  
17. base_url – URL route prefix

.env File Configuration

# Server port
port=5567

# Root directory for file management. If not specified, defaults to the program's execution directory.
# Example: base_folder=D:\ or /home/user
#base_folder=D:\ or /home/user

# Local login credentials
username=admin
password=admin

# Directory for storing program data. It is recommended to use an empty directory.
# Example: work_dir=D:\data or /home
#work_dir=D:\data or /home

# Use this to reset the root password
reset_root_password=

# Use this to reset the root username
reset_root_username=
